definitions.definition: A characteristic or quality of a thing.
definitions.example: His finest attribute is his kindness.

definitions.definition: (grammar) A word that qualifies a noun, a qualifier.
definitions.example: In the clause "My jacket is more expensive than yours", "My" is the attribute of "jacket".

definitions.definition: That which is predicated or affirmed of a subject; a predicate; an accident.
An option or setting belonging to some object.
definitions.example: A file with the read-only attribute set cannot be overwritten.

definitions.definition: A semantic item with which a method or other code element may be decorated.
definitions.example: Properties can be marked as obsolete with an attribute, which will cause the compiler to generate a warning if they are used.

definitions.definition: A numeric value representing the colours of part of the screen display.
To ascribe (something) to a given cause, reason etc.
To associate ownership or authorship of (something) to someone.
definitions.example: This poem is attributed to Browning.
